description.narrative: Brunswick Rail (Brunswick or the Group) is a Bermudian holding company which provides freight railcars to corporate clients in the Russian Federation primarily on an operating lease basis via its railcar owning subsidiaries. Brunswick is one of the largest privately-owned freight railcar leasing companies active in the Russian Federation with a fleet of over 22,000 railcars. The Group is looking to expand its fleet to optimize its operations and achieve the critical mass it needs to thrive in the sector. IFC has an equity stake in Brunswick and has provided loans to several of its subsidiaries, inclusive of OOO Brunswick Rail Leasing, OOO Brunswick Rail Service, Brunswick Rail Holding Limited, and Brunswick Wagon Leasing.

The Project would: (i) support the continued development of a key private sector player in the relatively new Russian railcar leasing sector; (ii) contribute to the development of the transportation and logistics sectors in the Russian Federation, facilitating economic growth particularly in the economically disadvantaged hinterland and (iii) enable Brunswick Rail to access the debt markets in the future to finance the purchase of additional railcars, foster the introduction of new casting technology improving efficiency on the Russian rail network and participate in the consolidation of the Russian rail sector. Rail transportation is vital to the Russian economy and Brunswick Rail''s strategy to expand its fleet with new, modern railcars will improve the quality of railcars used in Russia. The majority of the Group''s fleet is unrelated to the oil sector and thus helps facilitate the diversification of the economy. Brunswick Rail''s new, more reliable railcars also help mitigate the risk of trucking replacing railways which would result in an increase of harmful greenhouse gases.
